title: Announcing "Dis-Ordered: A Christian Journey Through the Problem of Evil & Suffering"

Book Synopsis:

“Where are you, God?”

Do you remember the first time that you asked that question? It may have been an instance of unexpected suffering, a tragic confrontation with evil, or simply a moment where your soul quietly panged over prayers that felt unanswered. Maybe the particular church you were raised in didn’t seem like it had adequate answers for your profound questions about God’s goodness, evil, and suffering.  Mine didn’t. If that happens, should we just throw in the towel on our faith?

For 2,000 years, Christians across theological traditions have grappled with the problem of evil. What if we could dig through not only the Scriptures, but compare their answers on some of our deepest questions? Might this possibly give us better answers to our questions- even answers we may have never considered before?

In Dis-Ordered: A Christian Journey Through the Problem of Evil & Suffering, Paul Anleitner (MA Christian Thought, Bethel Seminary) leads readers on an impartial journey through the Bible and 2,000 years of Christian theology to help them understand Christianity’s most robust responses to the problem of evil and suffering. From the book of Job to the Gospels, from ancient Church Fathers to modern Open Theists and more, we’ll compare and contrast perspectives, sprinkle in some nerdy pop culture illustrations, and equip you to respond well to a world that so often seems dis-ordered.
